Key Match Events: The Cleveland Cavaliers staged a sensational second-half comeback to preserve their perfect start to the season with a 105-100 defeat of the Brooklyn Nets.
Evan Mobley led the Cleveland scoring with 23 points and made four steals and a block.
The Cavaliers outscored Brooklyn 35-18 in the final period.
Darius Garland's two free throws put Cleveland 97-96 ahead with just over two minutes remaining.
Evan Mobley made an emphatic block of a Cameron Johnson layup in the closing seconds.
Post-Match Reflections: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson praised the team's resilience in grinding out a win despite being below-par for long periods.
Atkinson highlighted the importance of preserving the team’s unbeaten start to the season as a key motivator.
